statements: SELECT questionnaire_id, question_text, created_date FROM survey_questionnaires;
SELECT * FROM survey_answers WHERE respondent_name = 'John Doe';
SELECT answer_text, respondent_name, answer_date FROM survey_answers ORDER BY answer_date DESC;
SELECT questionnaire_id, COUNT(*) AS total_answers FROM survey_answers GROUP BY questionnaire_id;
SELECT * FROM survey_answers WHERE answer_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-03-31';
SELECT * FROM survey_questionnaires;
SELECT questionnaire_id, question_text FROM survey_questionnaires ORDER BY questionnaire_id DESC;
SELECT answer_id, answer_text, respondent_name FROM survey_answers WHERE respondent_name LIKE 'John%' ORDER BY answer_date ASC;
SELECT questionnaire_id, COUNT(*) AS total_answers FROM survey_answers GROUP BY questionnaire_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 5;
SELECT MAX(answer_date) AS latest_answer_date FROM survey_answers;
SELECT * FROM questionnaires;
SELECT questionnaire_id, questionnaire_text FROM questionnaires;
SELECT * FROM answers WHERE questionnaire_id = 1;
SELECT answer_id, answer_text FROM answers WHERE questionnaire_id = 2;
SELECT questionnaire_id, count(*) AS total_answers FROM answers GROUP BY questionnaire_id;
SELECT * FROM questionnaires;
SELECT questionnaire_id, questionnaire_text FROM questionnaires ORDER BY questionnaire_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM answers WHERE questionnaire_id = 1;
SELECT MAX(answer_id) AS max_answer_id FROM answers;
SELECT questionnaire_text, answer_text FROM questionnaires JOIN answers ON questionnaires.questionnaire_id = answers.questionnaire_id WHERE answers.answer_id IN (1, 2, 3);
SELECT * FROM SurveyQuestions;
SELECT question, id FROM SurveyQuestions ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT participant_name, email FROM SurveyParticipants WHERE id = 1;
SELECT id, answer FROM SurveyAnswers WHERE question_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM SurveyParticipants ORDER BY participant_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM SurveyQuestions ORDER BY id DESC LIMIT 3
SELECT question FROM SurveyQuestions WHERE id = 2
SELECT participant_name, email FROM SurveyParticipants WHERE id BETWEEN 1 AND 5
SELECT question, answer FROM SurveyQuestions INNER JOIN SurveyAnswers ON SurveyQuestions.id = SurveyAnswers.question_id
SELECT * FROM SurveyParticipants WHERE email LIKE '%@example.com'
SELECT * FROM survey_questionnaires;
SELECT id, question FROM survey_questionnaires;
SELECT respondents.name, responses.id, answers.answer_text FROM respondents, responses, answers WHERE respondents.id = responses.respondent_id AND responses.answer_id = answers.id;
SELECT answers.answer_text, respondents.name FROM answers, respondents, responses WHERE answers.id = responses.answer_id AND responses.respondent_id = respondents.id;

SELECT respondents.name, survey_questionnaires.question, answers.answer_text FROM respondents JOIN responses ON respondents.id = responses.respondent_id JOIN answers ON responses.answer_id = answers.id;
SELECT * FROM survey_questionnaires ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT question FROM survey_questionnaires WHERE id = 1;
SELECT name, answer_text FROM respondents INNER JOIN responses ON respondents.id = responses.respondent_id;
SELECT question, answer_text FROM survey_questionnaires JOIN answers ON survey_questionnaires.id = answers.questionnaire_id;
SELECT respondent_id, COUNT(answer_id) FROM responses GROUP BY respondent_id ORDER BY COUNT(answer_id) DESC;
SELECT * FROM SurveyQuestionnaires;
SELECT title, question FROM SurveyQuestionnaires WHERE survey_id = 1;
SELECT respondent_name, answer_text FROM SurveyAnswers ORDER BY answer_id DESC;
SELECT respondent_name, email FROM Respondents WHERE email IS NOT NULL;
SELECT username, email FROM SurveyUsers WHERE username LIKE 'S%';
SELECT * FROM SurveyQuestionnaires;
SELECT survey_id, title FROM SurveyQuestionnaires WHERE survey_id = 1;
SELECT respondent_name, answer_text FROM SurveyAnswers WHERE survey_id = 2 ORDER BY respondent_name ASC;
SELECT DISTINCT respondent_name FROM SurveyAnswers WHERE survey_id = 3;
SELECT survey_id, count(*) AS total_logs FROM SurveyLogs GROUP BY survey_id ORDER BY total_logs DESC;
